item.title: Ethernet vs SONET Throw Down
item.description:
Let’s compare SONET and Carrier Ethernet, two contenders for the top spot in high-speed business bandwidth. SONET, or Synchronous Optical NETwork, is a fiber optic transmission system using Time Division Multiplexing (TDM). Primarily used by telephone companies to boost their digital trunk capacity, it’s known for its redundant data rings over fiber optic cables, which create an automatic failover mechanism in case of a network disruption. While perfect for carrier-grade digitized phone calls, SONET can also handle packetized data including voice, video, and standard T1 or T3 lines...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/ethernet-vs-sonet-throw-down/
